intro: Vesicaria argyraea, commonly known as the silver bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its bladdery leaves that allow it to float on the surface of water bodies. The plant is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Vesicaria argyraea plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to water oxygenation.
